member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions
member.summary: Enum specifying which conflicts will be resolved as automerge

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.None
member.summary: Does nothing

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.OnlyLocalTarget
member.summary: Only conflicts with ChangeSummary.TotalConflicting = 0 and TotalLatest = 0 will be resolved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.OnlyServerSource
member.summary: Only conflicts with ChangeSummary.TotalConflicting = 0 and TotalModified = 0 will be resolved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.BothLocalTargetAndServerSource
member.summary: All conflicts with ChangeSummary.TotalConflict = 0 will be resolved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.IncomingRename
member.summary: Conflict that include source/server rename, but not local/target rename will be resolved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.Redundant
member.summary: Behavior intended for Gated Checkin: - only version Get/Checkin - if Your and Their change is identical, content, encoding and path are identical resolves conflicts as TakeTheirs Content is compared for Edit and Branch changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.Silent
member.summary: Conflicts that require name or encoding parameters are not reported to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.AllContent
member.summary: All conflicts will be resolved and conflict that require name or encoding will be reported to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.All
member.summary: All content and redundant conflicts will be resolved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.AutoResolveOptions.AllSilent
member.summary: All conflicts will be resolved, conflict that require name or encoding will be ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinEvaluationOptions.AddMissingFieldValues
member.summary: Supply this bit only in combination with the Notes bit. Indicates that the EvaluateCheckin family of methods should modify the CheckinNote object provided to add CheckinNoteFieldValues for checkin notes that are defined, but for which no value was supplied. The values will be added with a value of String.Empty. The string casing of the Name part of each CheckinNoteFieldValue provided by the caller will also be corrected to match the casing in the corresponding CheckinNoteFieldDefinition.

member.summary: Evaluate all items.

member.summary: Create a new CreateWorkspaceParameters instance to supply data to VersionControlServer.CreateWorkspace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.Comment
member.summary: A descriptive comment to be associated with the workspace to be created. The default value for this parameter is the empty string (String.Empty).
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.Computer
member.summary: The computer on which the workspace to be created will reside. The default value for this parameter is Workstation.Current.Name.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.Folders
member.summary: The initial working folders (mappings) for the workspace to be created. The default value for this parameter is an empty array.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.Location
member.summary: Set this value to WorkspaceLocation.Local to indicate the workspace to be created should be a local workspace. Set this value to WorkspaceLocation.Server to indicate the workspace to be created should be a server-side or "traditional" workspace, which is the only kind of workspace backward compatible with TFS 2005-2010 clients. The default value if not provided is determined from the server.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.OwnerDisplayName
member.summary: The owner display name of the workspace to be created. The default value for this parameter is RepositoryConstants.AuthenticatedUser (or "."), which indicates that the server should create the workspace on behalf of the calling user. If you are not sure who this resolves to, the value of the AuthorizedUser property of the VersionControlServer object gives the full display name form of the calling user.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.OwnerName
member.summary: The owner name of the workspace to be created. The default value for this parameter is RepositoryConstants.AuthenticatedUser (or "."), which indicates that the server should create the workspace on behalf of the calling user. If you are not sure who this resolves to, the value of the AuthorizedUser property of the VersionControlServer object gives the full display name form of the calling user.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.PermissionProfile
member.summary: The workspace permission profile for the workspace to be created. A workspace permission profile is a template for the workspace's access control list. By default, the value for this parameter is WorkspacePermissionProfile.BuiltInProfiles[(int)WorkspacePermissionProfile.BuiltInIndexes.Private], which only grants permission to the owner of the workspace (a 'private' workspace).
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.RemoveUnparentedCloaks
member.summary: If true, any cloaks in the initial working folders (this.Folders) which are not parented by a mapping are removed silently. The default value is false.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.WorkspaceName
member.summary: The name of the workspace to be created.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CreateWorkspaceParameters.WorkspaceOptions
member.summary: Options for the workspace.
member.returns: Returns .

member.summary: Default behavior. Sorting is performed and no download information is generated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.Download
member.summary: If set, causes download information to be generated. Set this only if you plan to download the contents of the file after you call GetItems().

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.Unsorted
member.summary: Speeds GetItems() by not sorting the result items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.IncludeBranchInfo
member.summary: Includes information about whether an item is a branch object in the system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.IncludeSourceRenames
member.summary: Include items that are the source of a rename.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.LocalOnly
member.summary: Only available in local workspaces. Will cause the retrieval of items from the local table, without making a server call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetItemsOptions.IncludeRecursiveDeletes
member.summary: Instructs the server to return items which are affected by a Recursive Delete

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions
member.summary: Options for the Get operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.None
member.summary: No options were specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite existing writable files if they conflict with the downloaded files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.GetAll
member.summary: Gets all files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.Preview
member.summary: Executes a get without modifying the disk.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.Remap
member.summary: Remaps existing items on the disk to the server items where the content and disk location are not changing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOptions.NoAutoResolve
member.summary: Used only on the client. Instructs the client not to try to auto resolve conflicts

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.IPolicyCompatibility.GetAssemblyName
member.summary: Used for backward compatibility where you must specify a different assembly name for the checkin policy in order to maintain backward compatibility with a previously released version of the checkin policy.
member.returns: The assembly name that should be stored in the metadata.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.IPolicyCompatibility.GetBinaryFormatter
member.summary: This is necessary if you want to create a new BinaryFormatter and hook into the serialization process for backward compatibility (e.g., you want to set the Binder property on the formatter to handle compat for a checkin policy that has been moved to another assembly). If you do not want to hook into the serialization process, just return new BinaryFormatter().
member.returns: the BinaryFormatter to use for serializing the policy

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters
member.summary: Represents all the parameters that are required to call the QueryHistory method on the VersionControlServer object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.#ctor(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ItemSpec)
member.summary: Creates a new QueryHistoryParameters object.
member.param: An ItemSpec describing the item whose history is to be retrieved, its deletion id, and the recursion type at which the query should be performed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.RecursionType)
member.summary: Creates a new QueryHistoryParameters object.
member.param: The item whose history is to be retrieved. The last path part may include the ? and * wildcard characters, that is $/Abc/def/*.cs. The item may be a server or a local path.

The recursion type to apply to the provided path. When querying the history of files, it is common to provide RecursionType.None. When querying the history of a folder, it is common to provide RecursionType.Full.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.Author
member.summary: This property defaults to null. Set this property to restrict the history query to the set of changesets authored by a particular identity. For TFS 2010 servers and earlier, this property must be in the form "DOMAIN\user". Later servers accept identities in this format, and also display names ("Maggie Carrido").
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.BatchSize
member.summary: The batch size for the QueryHistory paging mechanism. The default value for this property is 256.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.DeletionId
member.summary: If the path provided in the Item property is deleted, the deletion ID of the particular item referred to by the Item property may be provided here. Defaults to zero; supplying another value for this property is not common, and is only necessary when you use TFS 2005 or 2008.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.IncludeChanges
member.summary: Set this property to true if you need for the returned Changeset objects to contain actual Change objects (the manifest of the changeset). By default, this property is false, and the Changeset objects returned will contain only the changeset metadata. Note that even when this property is set to true, the set of returned Change objects is scoped to the Item/RecursionType pair used to perform the query.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.IncludeDownloadInfo
member.summary: This property applies only when IncludeChanges is set to true. Set this property to true to have the server generate download URLs and include them with the Change objects returned in each Changeset. This allows the client to download the file content associated with a particular Change object by using one round-trip to the server instead of two. Setting this property to true increases the computation time on the server for the QueryHistory call, and also the size of the result set on the wire. For performance reasons, you should enable this flag only if you intend to download the content the returned Change objects.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.Item
member.summary: The item whose history is to be retrieved. The last path part may include the ? and * wildcard characters, that is $/Abc/def/*.cs. The item may be a server or a local path.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.ItemVersion
member.summary: A VersionSpec describing the point in time at which the path provided in the Item property should be resolved. Defaults to VersionSpec.Latest; supplying another value for this property is not common.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.MaxResults
member.summary: Set this property to limit the number of results returned by the QueryHistory call. By default, this property is set to Int32.MaxValue. QueryHistory pages results back from the server on demand. Therefore, limiting your own consumption of the IEnumerable is almost as effective from a performance perspective.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.RecursionType
member.summary: The recursion type to apply to the Item property when you perform the history query.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.SlotMode
member.summary: If this property is false, then the (Item, ItemVersion, DeletionId) tuple is resolved to an item ID and the history is performed on that item ID, tracking across renames. If this property is true, then the tuple is not resolved. Instead, all changesets which have an item with the name Item (or underneath it, if the query is recursive), are returned. That is, the query is on a particular "namespace slot" (slot mode) instead of on a particular item. This property defaults to true.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.SortAscending
member.summary: By default, the results from a QueryHistory call are from VersionEnd to VersionStart (reverse order). If you want the results to be returned in ascending order instead (from VersionStart to VersionEnd), set this flag to true. This flag requires a TFS 2010 or a later version server to have any effect.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.VersionEnd
member.summary: Set this property to restrict the history query along the time axis. This property defaults to null, to indicate that the range of the history query starts with the latest changeset in the repository.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.QueryHistoryParameters.VersionStart
member.summary: Set this property to restrict the history query along the time axis. This property defaults to null, to indicate that the range of the history query goes all the way back to when the repository was created.
member.returns: Returns .

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that describes whether to accept a merge regardless of content conflicts.

member.summary: Queue a request to tell the server the local disk location of an item in the workspace.
member.param: The committed server path of the item in the workspace, or the target server item if the item is uncommitted (pending add or branch)
Item ID of the item in the workspace (optional; used for backward compatibility with TFS 2010 and earlier servers)
New local path of the item, or null to remove it from the workspace
The version of the item in the workspace. If zero, the request refers to the uncommitted slot for the item ID. If non-zero, the request refers to the committed slot for the item ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.UpdateLocalVersionQueue.QueueUpdate(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int64)

Item ID of the item in the workspace (optional; used for backward compatibility with TFS 2010 and earlier servers)
New local path of the item, or null to remove it from the workspace
The version of the item in the workspace. If zero, the request refers to the uncommitted slot for the item ID. If non-zero, the request refers to the committed slot for the item ID.

member.summary: Permanently deletes the subtree, starting at the specified item.
member.returns: The array of items that were destroyed.
member.param: The local or server path of an item that will be recursively destroyed.
The version of the item.
The version spec (not label or workspace) that influences keepHistory mode behavior.

The set of destroy flags that affects the Destroy: operation. KeepHistory: True to remove only the content of every version of a file up to but not including the changeset that is represented by stopAt. Force: True to asynchronously initialize content garbage collection. Preview: True to make sure that no database data will be deleted. Only a list of items that would have been destroyed is returned.

member.summary: Permanently deletes the subtree, starting at the specified item.
member.returns: The array of items that were destroyed. Null if the Silent flag is specified.
member.param: The local or server path of an item that will be recursively destroyed.
The version of the item.
The version spec (not label or workspace) that influences keepHistory mode behavior.

The set of destroy flags that affects the Destroy: operation. KeepHistory: True to remove only the content of every version of a file up to but not including the changeset that is represented by stopAt. Force: True to asynchronously initialize content garbage collection. Preview: True to make sure that no database data will be deleted. Only a list of items that would have been destroyed is returned. Silent: True to return no data to the client. AffectedChanges: True to enable that pending changes and shelved changes that will be destroyed will be returned in affectedPendingChanges and affectedShelvedChanges. This can be set only if Preview is set. If set, the return value array will be empty.
The pending changes that will be destroyed.
The shelved changes that will be destroyed.

member.summary: Gets an array of extended items in the version-control repository that match the specified criteria, for each ItemSpec.
member.returns: An array of ExtendedItem arrays, each of which contains the matching ExtendedItem instances that are associated with each specified ItemSpec.

Flag that specifies whether to include deleted items, items that are not deleted, or both.
Flag that specifies whether to include files, folders, or both.
One or more of the enum values (None, Download, Unsorted, IncludeBranchInfo, IncludeSourceRenames) for getting items.

member.summary: For each input ItemSpec, retrieves a list of extended items in the repository that match the specified criteria. If the 'path' argument is a file, returns a set of items that contain just that file. If the 'path' is a folder, returns a set of items that contain all items in that folder. If the 'path' contains a wildcard character, returns a set of items in the specified folder that match the wildcard.
member.returns: An array of ExtendedItem arrays, each containing the matching ExtendedItem instances associated with each specified ItemSpec
member.param: The item specifiers for the item(s) being listed, may be server or local
A flag representing whether to return deleted items, non-deleted items, or both
A flag representing whether to return files, folders, or both
Options
A list of properties to query.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.GetPendingChanges(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ItemSpec[],System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Gets all of the pending changes for these items and potentially subitems in this workspace.
member.returns: The pending changes for the specified items in this workspace
member.param: A list of item specifications for the items being queried

If true, the server will include the information that is required to download files. Only set this to true if you will be downloading the files by using the objects that are returned. The call will be faster and require less bandwidth when this parameter is false (default for overloads that do not specify it)
The maximum number of pending changes to return in this page. Fewer pending changes could be returned if there are not enough pending changes for a full page.

The server path of the last pending change in the previous page. For the first page this value should be null. For subsequent pages, the server path of the last pending change in the page should be used.
Whether to include source information about renames / merges
List of property names to return on the pending change object if they exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.IsScannerAsynchronous
member.summary: This flag applies only to local workspaces (Location == WorkspaceLocation.Local). If true, then the VersionControlServer which owns this Workspace will raise the PendingChangesChanged and GetCompleted events as soon the disk scanner notices that something has changed on disk. That is, the generation of those events is truly asynchronous. If false, the disk scanner only runs when it is required for correctness -- as a part of calls to this Workspace object's public methods. The events will still raise, but they will raise after the scanned API call which notices them, instead of as soon as they occur on disk. The default is false. Setting this flag to true may decrease performance, but it is useful for the construction of a feature such as an always-up-to-date list of pending changes in the workspace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceCheckInParameters.NoConflictsCheckForGatedCheckin
member.summary: This flag only affects the server's behavior when the server paths being checked in affect a gated build definition. In this case the server will ordinarily call CheckPendingChanges before shelving the workspace and throwing back a GatedCheckinException. If the call to CheckPendingChanges creates conflicts, then no GatedCheckinException will be thrown; instead CheckIn fails and informs the user that they must resolve their conflicts. If this flag is specified, this call to CheckPendingChanges is skipped. This allows the gated checkin shelveset to be created even when the items being checked in are not at latest, for example. The build agent workspace will unshelve the shelveset and attempt to resolve conflicts at that time. This is a liberalization of the default behavior. Therefore, the default value for this flag is false.
